reviews.sentence: Stopped overnight while travelling. Right off I75 Friendly staff great breakfast selection cookies upon arrival clean indoor pool everything we were looking for. A wide variety of restaurants nearby. We picked our dinner up on the way in and ate in the lobby.

Satisfied hotel stay. We requested 2 adjoining rooms or 2 rooms right next to each other. We were told we could get this. However the rooms were on opposite ends of the hall. Other than that our stay was good. Rooms were clean fitness room was nice and useful pool was good and breakfast was okay.

My review. it is a nice hotel. Go ahead and stay here. it is a good location. It has very comfortable accommodations and friendly staff. There is also a very nice pool and a very nice exercise room at your disposal.
A Good Hotel. A good hotel. Clean and Comfortable with a nice pool area. What I would expect from a value hotel. Nice sized refrigerator in the room.

Nice hotel rooms with nice location. This hotel is nice and has a professional staff. The indoor pool is a nice size with plenty of leisure space around it. The breakfast is a good value. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. I would stay here again while in Lexington.

Perfect location from highway and warmest pool ever. We chose this hotel since it was our half way point to Tennessee. The clerk checking us in I believe her name was Desirae sp. was so polite and courteous. The swimming pool was the best ever heated very nicely. Breakfast was great too. Lots of choices and the coffee was excellent.

Great stay. We stayed here for a few days on a short get away trip. This hotel is very clean and the staff was exceptionally well. The complementary breakfast was good and had lots of selections. The pool and workout area was very nice and clean. Definitely will be staying again. The only complaint we had were the beds were too small and too hard for our liking. But other than that we had a great time here.

Convienent To I75 exit 110. This motel is a little older but seemed very clean. My wife said it seemed a little musty in the hallway but I did not notice it. Very convenient location to restaurants shopping interstate. Friendly check in our room was satisfactory but small bathroom was small. Everything that we needed for a 3 night stay. It is pet friendly and has a nice looking indoor pool. Unusual for most Hamptons. Breakfast was just OK try the fruit and the oatmeal and a pastry. Evidently lots of tour busses stop here. Even though it is close to I75 I did not hear any noise from traffic.

Nice hotel good value. Loved the freshly baked cookies clean room friendly staff nice pool easy check in and out. Only complaint is that breakfast juices had not been shaken up and mostly water came out of the dispenser. Otherwise a perfect score.

Quick stop. Great overnight stay on our way home from vacation. Room was clean pool was a nice addition for the kids. Breakfast had a nice variety of items from waffles to eggs sausage cereal oatmeal yogurt juices coffee etc.

The staff were great but the hotel is in need of some basic renovation. Our room smelled slightly like smoke like it had been a smoking room in the past maybe another coat of paint. New mattresses. The pool area had some ceiling damage. Overall it was fine and served its purpose.

Could use new mattress. The staff was very friendly from the moment we arrived. The desk staff was genuinely interested in what brought us to Lexington and even made recommendations during our stay. The breakfast was typical yet plentiful. The pool area although clean looked like the ceiling had been damaged and badly repair. Yet the most problem we experienced was poor quality of sleep due to an old mattress. The sides slopped making us feel as if we would slide off. The pillows were actually good but the mattress needs to be replaced. The room could also use some updated but neat and clean.

Wait Until Construction is Complete. I ’ve stayed at this Hampton Inn many times every spring fall for past 5 6 years historically ave made it my hotel of choice among about 8 hotels available at this exit. However last weekend when we stayed we were in midst of major construction zone. Upon arrival we had to navigate around construction workers installing lighting in lobby. Plaster or paint was smeared across floor in reception area throughout our entire weekend visit. Construction equipment was scattered around the lobby during the day stacked up in hallway between elevator back entrance at night. Second floor where our room was located had elevator lobby area with no floor covering — carpet ripped up exposing rough concrete. No sign of current work to replace carpet of flooring during our stay. Walking down hall from elevator to room wiring was visible near ceiling lights at each doorway wall paper had lots of loose places. Entrance to our room had a piece of loose carpet sticking up. The room itself was ok except shabby. Also the room fridge was turned off so we were forced to toss food we stored overnight when we realized we had failed to notice warm fridge upon our arrival. Once we turned the fridge on it worked fine but honestly — who thinks about need to turn on a fridge before use — once installed most of us simply keep the fridge on. To be fair when we made reservation hotel did note that pool Was closed due to hotel renovations. This would make no difference as I never use the pool. However I had no idea I ’d be roughing it in the mess dodging construction workersThis hotel tends to be more expensive than the other hotels at this exit for years I have liked this hotel well enough to pay more to stay anyway because it has been an unusually nice one. However this time it was clearly not worth the cost. I ’l probably return at some point but I ’l be sure to confirm construction is complete. Staffer told me construction began last November is scattered throughout hotel — not possible to escape the mess.

Pool closed hotel rundown and extensive renovations underway yet Expedia charged 159 per night and no warning about conditions. Also Expedia had picture of pool in its ad for hotel. will not use Expedia again for bookings.

Worst hotel ever. We visited this hotel for a family vacation. First thing is did not tell us that the hotel was under going renovations. Constant banging and hammering all week. 3. Breakfast was cold eggs were cold bacon sausage were cold. It was a mess dirty from construction. Pool was closed did not tell us about it. I would never stay there again and not recommend ever to anyone.

We were not informed this Hampton was being remodeled. There was a tar smell in our room. The HVAC had a label on the control panel cover to adjust the Temperature at the wall Thermostat but we could not find any. What sounded like a jack hammer went on for hours both days we were there. The pool and hot tub were not available. The floor in both elevators were cracked and broken. Contractors were working overhead from articulating boom lifts across the entire front of the building.

Terrible stay. Renovating the hotel we were not informed of that when I made the reservation the pool was not serviceable the staff in guessing was stresedThe beds were not comfortable Stay at your own risk. Never again for me and my family. EVER.
they ’re freaking always remodeling bro. nice new rooms tho. no pool or gym nasty food.
Wish that Hotelscom had the info from the Hampton Inn was under construction and the pool was not working.
